meanings.definition: Relating to the scientific study of planets.
meanings.sent1: The planetological research team discovered a new exoplanet.
meanings.sent2: Her planetological observations helped advance our understanding of Mars.
meanings.sent3: The planetological conference was out of this world!
meanings.sent4: His planetological expertise was as vast as the universe itself.
meanings.sent5: The planetological data was as clear as the night sky.

meanings.definition: Involving the characteristics or processes of planets.
meanings.sent1: The planetological features of Jupiter are fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The planetological changes on Earth affect all living beings.
meanings.sent3: The planetological puzzle was challenging but fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a planetological depth that seemed infinite.
meanings.sent5: The planetological patterns in the sky were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A person who specializes in the study of planets.
meanings.sent1: The planetological was excited to explore the newly discovered planet.
meanings.sent2: She became a planetological after years of studying the solar system.
meanings.sent3: The planetological's telescope was their most prized possession.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the planetological who could predict celestial events.
meanings.sent5: The planetological's passion for astronomy was contagious.
